question: 住人
sourceMnemonic: If you <kanji>dwell</kanji> somewhere and you’re a <kanji>person</kanji>, that makes you a <vocabulary>resident</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>人</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

All the <vocabulary>resident</vocabulary>s in my area care about is <reading>jew</reading>els and <reading>Nin</reading>tendo (<ja>じゅうにん</ja>). Their houses are crammed full of jewels and Nintendo stuff. How about the residents of your town? I bet they all love jewels and Nintendo too.
